topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/531bbaa6636872125db40000#post_531bbaa6636872125db40000
Okay, Here's how I think it would go,

Coop basically Just lives his life in that verse, New Jersey is never really attacked or anything, And He Isn't really too involved in the Events of Zeta gundam because He's just a citizen,

He would have joined the Federation or the Titans at some point, But he was either too lazy, Or found the Mobile suits, Valkyries, And Personal troopers Boring

Kiva is from an Alternate Future where Most of the Super robots are Outdated or something, So the Aliens kick their asses, And they build a New super robot, And Send it to the past to try to change things, Coop finds the robot, He fixes it up, Eventually through some contrived coincidences, He ends up fighting alongside Londo bell (The Banner which all of the Heroes are banded under)

topics.body:
Stupid question time:  Why are american shows so uncreative in general?  I don't mean that all shows are bad and unoriginal, but for the part they fall into massively common unoriginal tropes of crime drama, talent shows, tmz level entertainment, reality tv, shows that nuked the fridge or shows that should have ended years ago (cough) family guy (cough).

There's lots of good shows, but why is 90% of tv crap though?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/531cd9d76368726ad64a0000#post_531cd9d76368726ad64a0000
Today's media, in general, is uncreative. Look at how heavy Japanese anime are in the fanservice materials. And the fact that they reference other medias a lot. Everything that needed to be done, had already been done. Everything is so standardized. There is really actually not much room for creativity anymore.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/531ce0db6368727c152c0000#post_531ce0db6368727c152c0000

its not about creativity but how its delivered, look at rick and morty for example, the show aint that creative in the main premise, but it delivers good.
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
Since I'm talking about tv and this sort of goes hand in hand, since scifi is fiction, well turns out I've been massively fucking wrong about something big and most people have been too.

You know how people keep saying that human level intelligence in computers is still fifty plus years from now?  Turns out yeah this will probably happen sooner.  I found out about the "singularity summit" which actually talks about this.  The actually estimates are anywhere from 2017 to 2112.  There's a 10% chance by 2028, a 50% chance by 2050 and a 90% chance by 2112.

The top three predictions are by kurzwell places it as before 2050, vinge places it as before 2030 and stuart armstrong as somewhere around 2040.

I'm going to have to go with vinge on this one.  The reason being is simple; businesses want human level intelligence ai to run their businesses that are preprogrammed with the know how of all of economics and such to have record high profit.  The problem with that is that programming something to control a entire business internationally all the way from the bottom of handling groceries to the top of investment without fail would be fucking hard.  Imagine it; programming something 100% line by line every little bit to handle every operation of a business without missing a beat.  Imagine how long that's going to take.

The military wants skynet, but they want a skynet that is 100% completely coded by humans that they can control without fail and without it ever making a mistake.  The problem with that is without how chaotic and unpredictable the battlefield can be making a ai that can 100% ensure 100% of the time no accidental friendly fire.

Academia just wants grant money.  My money is on someone using the blue brain project's research to do so.  If it's them that's first we don't really have anything to worry about.  The reason being is that their goal is basically a artificial human brain, not skynet.  Less skynet and more ghost in the shell.  Less T-100 and more tachikoma.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
